entry.title: SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT, Kirkland Lake
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 5:57 a.m. EDT Tuesday 4 April 2023

entry.title: Tuesday night: Periods of snow. Low minus 7. POP 60%
entry.summary: Increasing cloudiness. 60 percent chance of light snow late this evening and after midnight. Snow beginning after midnight. Amount 5 cm. Wind becoming east 20 km/h gusting to 40 this evening. Low minus 7. Wind chill minus 7 this evening and minus 14 overnight. Forecast issued 4:00 PM EDT Tuesday 4 April 2023

entry.title: Wednesday: Periods of ice pellets mixed with snow. High minus 2.
entry.summary: Snow changing to periods of ice pellets mixed with snow in the morning and then changing to freezing rain mixed with ice pellets in the afternoon. Wind east 30 km/h gusting to 50. High minus 2. Wind chill minus 14 in the morning and minus 9 in the afternoon. UV index 2 or low. Forecast issued 4:00 PM EDT Tuesday 4 April 2023

entry.title: Wednesday night: Chance of showers. Temperature rising to 6 by morning. POP 40%
entry.summary: Periods of freezing rain mixed with ice pellets ending late in the evening then cloudy with 40 percent chance of rain showers. Wind east 20 km/h gusting to 40 becoming light after midnight. Wind becoming southwest 20 gusting to 40 before morning. Temperature rising to 6 by morning. Wind chill minus 9 in the evening. Forecast issued 4:00 PM EDT Tuesday 4 April 2023
